Package substrings.algorithms

Class FindingsAK

  • java.lang.Object
    • substrings.algorithms.FindingsAK
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Finder
    public class FindingsAK
extends java.lang.Object
implements Finder
    Its dynamic implementation of Apostolico-Crochemore algorithm. If n - size of text, m - size of pattern, then

    - preprocessing phase in O(m) time and space complexity;

    - searching phase in O(n) time complexity;

    - performs 3/2n text character comparisons in the worst case.

    It uses table of shifts helpArray. Find occurs of pattern string in the text. It must be dynamic. So finding algorithm should work character by character. It allows to not save text in memory (RAM).

    See Also:
    nextChar(char), setPattern(String), Finder

      • nextChar

        public void nextChar​(char symbol)
        Get next symbol, analyze this, changes the internal state of finder. If there is occurrences of pattern in text, then position of this will be saved in the answerArray. This function is used for others algorithm, and user can use this for other text representation (pipes, sockets, buffer and etc).
        Specified by:
        nextChar in interface Finder
        Parameters:
        symbol - next symbol in the text.
